sentences:
mitu ~ kümme tuult jalg(ad)e all
ei tea, mis tulevik võib tuua, kuhu inimese
viia.
Noorel inimesel on veel kümme tuult jalge all.
context: The Estonian word 'viia' is a verb that means to carry, lead, bring or take something/someone from one place to another. It indicates movement of an object or person with the purpose of reaching a destination. In the given examples, it's used in the context where someone doesn't know what the future may bring or where life might lead them ('kuhu inimese viia' - where it will take a person).
